results.title: Understanding maternal grief
results.creator_credit: V and A Productions, Margaret Nicol and Tony Vuletich
results.brief_description: A five part series introduced by Margaret Nicol, clinical psychologist and author which deals with distinct aspects of maternal grief. The programmes are dedicated to all women who have grieved over the loss of a baby and to the memory of those children. Each episode is designed to look at the experiences of women who have suffered different types of reproductive loss. The focus is on the need for the womens’ experiences to be validated and for the existence of the lost child to be acknowledged.

results.title: Understanding is not enough
results.creator_credit: Indignata Filmnic, Uniting Church in Australia, Keith Head and Alison Head
results.brief_description: This film is a documentary about the Uniting Church and the liaison work it is involved in with the Aboriginal people in Victoria. By interviewing Aborigines and others involved in the liaison work, the film examines what it means to be Aboriginal in Victoria.

results.title: Understanding Herbal Medicine
results.brief_description: This program is a practical guide to basic herbal medicine. Common herbs are listed and their therapeutic qualities are described. An informative guide to alternative remedies for everyday health problems.

results.title: Understanding hearing loss
results.brief_description: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to be deaf? We can’t really reproduce that experience for hearing people, but here is a videotape that explains sound, hearing loss and the relationship between listening to speech and different kinds of hearing loss. Simulations of what speech sounds like with different kinds of hearing loss helps us to understand how much deaf people can get from listening and lipreading. Useful hints on how to communicate better with deaf people round off an informative introduction to hearing loss and its effect on learning and understanding.

results.title: Understanding government
results.creator_credit: Fontana Films, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Donald Dagett
results.brief_description: An introduction to government in Australia covering elections, the work of Parliament, the general organisation of the Public Service and the wide range of activities for which the government is responsible.

results.title: Understanding electronics: the transistor
results.creator_credit: Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward and Helmut Engelhardt
results.brief_description: In this film the early development of the transistor is traced, its natural superiority to the vacuum tube is made apparent, and its many modern applications are discussed.

results.title: Understanding discrimination
results.brief_description: Video based training program explains to employees what discrimination is, including direct and indirect discrimination. Also describes the steps an employee should take if they are being subjected to discriminatory behaviour. A manual complements the video and may be borowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Understanding different speech types. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This tape covers the different speech types of the procedure, the discussion, the exposition and the response. A sheet providing suggested exercises as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

results.title: Understanding color: color by addition
results.brief_description: The basic principles governing the addition of primary colors of light are explored. The film shows how the different hues of colored light are produced. In a special color television sequence, we see the best known example of color by addition.
